info.author: Chisato Bailey

description.p: You create a 30 foot by 30 foot floating platform that hovers 1 foot above the ground in a clear and open area. On each of your turns it can be moved (with abonus action) up to your movement speed in any direction. The platform cannot lower closer than one foot to any solid object. It weight limit is 1000 pounds and it may be banished at any time. as the platform disolves,

You create an invisible, magical eye within range that hovers in the air for the duration. You see through the eye, which has normal vision plus darkvision to 30 feet. The eye can look in every direction and fullfills the line of sight requirements for spellcasting. As a bonus action, you can move the eye up to 30 feet in any direction. There is no limit to how far away from you the eye can move, but it can't enter another plane of existence. A solid barrier blocks the eye's movement, but the eye can pass through an opening as small as 1 inch in diameter.

You must be able to write and the materials to do so. While pondering a question you enter a light trance and begin writing, after 10 minutes the spell is complete. Reading your script, you will find information about your query. Roll 1d20 and compare the result to the Automatic Writing Chart below to determine the extent of the information you uncover.

tr.td: One Minor clue to start your journey to knowledge.
Two minor clues and one major clue.
Two major clues and a partial answer.

element.name: Detect Secrets
element.supports: Sorcerer, Wizard, Warlock, Swordmage, Artificer, Cleric

description.p: You grant yourself magical perception that greatly enhances your ability to uncover that which is hidden. Beginning on your next turn after casting this spell, you are granted advantage on all Intelligence (Investigation) and Wisdom (Perception) checks made to uncover hidden objects, details, treasure, traps, or clues.

element.name: Discern Lies
element.supports: Sorcerer, Wizard, Warlock, Cleric, Bard, Druid

description.p: You grant yourself (or another) increased magical perception that greatly enhances your ability to detect lies as they are spoken to you. This includes half-truths and lies of omission. You gain advantage on all Intelligence (Investigation) and Wisdom (Perception), and Widsom(Insight) checks made to determine the veracity of another's words. Additionally, you make these rolls with proficiency. If you already have proficiency on the roll, then double your proficiecy bonus.

element.name: Dowsing
element.supports: Sorcerer, Wizard, Bard, Cleric, Swordmage, Druid, Ranger

description.p: You extend a stick or rod (whether a magical instrument or just something you grabbed off the ground) and concentrate on one type of thing (water, cats, people, bronze statuary, whatever) and you may learn the direction and location of the nearest example of what you seek. Roll 1d20, on a 10 or higher the spell works, if you roll lower than 10 the spell fails but you regain the spent spell slot. On a critical success you learn the precise location and distance, but on a botch, you lose the spell slot despite the failure.

With a muttered word, learning information becomes faster and easier. When casting this spell, you may make one ability check to learn information with advantage. You may cast this spell as a full action (rather than a bonus action) to extend the duration to 1 minute.
If you use a 2nd level spell slot (or higher) to cast this spell, the spell will affect one additional ally for every slot level above 1st.

With a wave of your hand you temporarily focus all your magical might on defense. Until the start of your next turn, you have advantage on all saving throws and all attacks made against you are made with disadvantage. Additionally, you may move without provoking opportunity attacks. The affect will end if you cast an offensive spell (one that does damage or requires a saving throw from an enemy) but you may cast other spells as normal.
When you reach 11th level the spell lasts for 2 turns rather than 1, and when you reach 17th level the spell becomes an aura that affects all allies within a 30-foot Radius.

element.name: Prescient Casting
element.supports: Sorcerer, Wizard, Cleric, Paladin, Swordmage, Druid

description.p: With a whispered word you look a few seconds into the future and learn your enemies’ defenses. This grants you advantage on all spell attack rolls and causes saving throws made (by enemies) to resist your spells to be rolled with disadvantage.

You touch or hold an object and cast your perceptions back along the object’s history. The longer you hold your concentration, the further back in time you will see. These “visions” are seen from a third-party point of view. You may discover information regarding the origin and history of the object itself or about events that happened around the object. This spell won’t tell you about magic affecting the object (although it will tell you if the object is, itself, magical) or information about people associated with the object.

When you reach 5th level you may use the spell on animals (non-sentient), once you have reached 11th level, your ability at regression has grown enough that it may be used on a willing person (sentient being), and at 17th level you may use the power on anyone or anything.

You cast your perceptions back along the history of your current location and a line of sight extending in a 50 ft radius. The longer you hold your concentration, the further back in time you will see. These “visions” are seen from a third-party point of view. You may discover information regarding events that happened in the immediate area and hear conversations that took place.

element.name: Remote Viewing
element.supports: Sorcerer, Wizard, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Ranger

description.p: You sit or lay down and enter a meditative state. Once in this trance you may focus on a destination and intuit details of the location and its environment up to and including information about enemies and other threats present. Roll 1d10 and compare it to the Remote Viewing Table to determine how much you learn.

tr.td: Basic Information only: General layout, presence of lifeforms.
Average Information: Full layout, Specific lifeforms, presence of non-living threats.
Excellent information: As above, plus Specific non-living threats.
All above information plus whatever else you want to know.

description.p: You must have ready access to a reflective material (mirror, still water, etc.). You gaze into the reflection while concentrating on what you wish to see (this can be anything within a 10 mile radius of your current position. You will immediately see your intended target in detail and a radius of 5 feet surrounding the target in murky detail. If you choose, you may make a Wisdom(Perception) check to clarify the area surrounding your target for free.
Casting this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher allows the scry image to serve as the line-of-sight requirement for casting other spells.

setters.set: A mirror or other reflective surface

element.name: Eyes of the Dead
element.supports: Sorcerer, Wizard, Cleric, Grave Warden, Druid, Warlock

description.p: While touching a corpse or skull, you witness the last living moments (1 minute) of the deceased person or creature. This time is "experienced" instantaneously.
At 5th level, the time witnessed extends to 10 minutes, at 11th level it becomes 1 hour and at 17th level you witness the person's or creatures final living day.

This simple spell allows the caster to increase (or decrease) the flow or movement of air in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on any point within 60 feet that the caster can see. The max speed that can be created (or reduced) by this spell is 5 MPH. The wind can be moved in whatever direction the caster wishes. Outside the spell's sphere the wind dies instantly.

As a bonus action on each of the caster's turns, they may move the sphere up to 120 feet.
If cast using a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher, the max speed change of the wind created by the spell increases by 10 MPH for every slot level above first. Additionally spending a 5th level (or higher) spell slot increases the size of the spell's sphere to a 50-foot-radius and the area becomes difficult terrain. Casting with an 8th level slot will can knock humanoids and small animals prone (Strength save verses caster's spell save DC to withstand this effect) and deal 5 force damage per round to any creature or object it hits. A 9th level slot increases this damage to 10 force and those creatures that are knocked prone are also pushed 10 feet per round. (Save Ends)

This spell clears an area of water and silt. The area cleared can measure up to a cube that is 25 feet on a side. The water moved vanishes into a pocket dimension and can be recalled by spending a bonus action or as a reaction.
At 5th level, the area drained increases to a cube that is 50 feet on a side, at 11th level it is 100 feet, and at 17th level it becomes 200 feet per side.

element.name: Excavate
element.supports: Sorcerer, Wizard, Druid, Bard, Ranger, Grave Warden

description.p: This spell clears an area of dirt and loose stone. The area cleared can measure up to 10 feet long, 5 feet wide, and 5 feet deep. The orientation of these dimensions is up to the caster. The earth moved vanishes into a pocket dimension and can be recalled by spending a bonus action or as a reaction.
Casting this spell with a spell slot of 3th level or higher increases the size of the excavated area by the same dimensions for each slot level above 2nd.

This spell fills an area with water. The water may be either fresh or sea water. The area filled can measure up to a cube that is 25 feet on a side. The water moved from a pocket dimension and can be banished by spending a bonus action.
At 5th level, the area drained increases to a cube that is 50 feet on a side, at 11th level it is 100 feet, and at 17th level it becomes 200 feet per side.

element.name: Make Whole
element.supports: Sorcerer, Wizard, Druid, Bard, Artificer, Warlock

description.p: Over thirty minutes, you can completely repair any one broken item that can fit into a cube that is 10 feet on a side. The spell may be used to fix items that are bigger than the area of the spell by performing the spell multiple times. The DM must decide how long this will take.
At 5th level, the area repaired increases to a cube that is 15 feet on a side, at 11th level it is 25 feet, and at 17th level it becomes 40 feet per side.
